topic.title: Abstract

body.p: The Management Central Packet Buffer (MCPB) provides connectivity for Ethernet management packets between the three ports on the Ethernet subsystem, the CPU, and the deviceâ€™s management port. The ENET Ingress port connects to the datapath between the ENET line (sink) and the system side (DCPB or ECPB). The ENET Egress and Reflect ports connect to the datapath between the system side (DCPB or ECPB) and the ENET line (source). The Reflect port is for packet extraction only and is used for PTP applications.
Maximum packet size for ENET ingress/egress/reflect paths and management FEGE paths to and from the CPU is 1526 bytes.
